overview:
Since 2005 Andy Patrick has served as President & CEO of liveBooks, Inc. a SaaS company providing award-winning websites that serve as a business hub to help creative professionals save time, promote their businesses and make more money.

Prior to liveBooks, Andy was a general partner and entrepreneur-in-residence at eSEED Capital, a technology-focused venture firm established in 1999 and funded by icons of Silicon Valley and India’s investment and technology community. Much of this time was spent in India focused on helping to develop India’s burgeoning technology sector.

He led strategic web consultancy Adjacency from a 1996 start-up to designing and building award-winning e-commerce solutions for Apple Computer, Patagonia, Virgin Megastores, LandRover, Caterpillar and Nordstrom, to a highly successful acquisition by Sapient in early 1999.

He is Founder & Executive Director of FiftyCrows Foundation, a non-profit he created in 2001 which supports international photojournalists and their efforts to document and distribute visual stories of the important social issues of our time. In 2004 he partnered with National Geographic Fellow Chris Rainier and National Geographic Explorer-in-Residence Wade Davis to create the All Roads Photography Awards which celebrate indigenous photographers documenting their own cultures.

He currently serves on the Board of Directors of Mohawk Fine Papers, and The Kinsey Institute, and has played active Board roles in numerous organizations including Richard Gere’s Foundation to preserve the culture of the Tibetan diaspora.
